FuncDef:
The port-observing observe-index command specifies an observing port on an interface board.
The undo port-observing observe-index command deletes the configuration.
By default, no observing port is configured.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the index of an observing port.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 255.

Disables the observing port from filtering mirrored packets.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
An observing port copies the packets sent from or received by the mirrored port to a packet analyzer. To check packets sent from or received by an interface, you can run the port-observing observe-index command to configure the interface as the mirrored port. Then, you can configure an observing port to copy packets (sent or received) on the mirrored port to a packet analyzer.
In the SIG mirroring scenario, if mirrored packet filtering is configured on the observing port, the filtering function does not take effect. As a result, packets do not match rules and are discarded. To resolve this problem, run the port-observing observe-index without-filter command.
Follow-up Procedure
An observing interface is configured and an observing port for the interface board is specified on the interface board where the mirrored port resides. Alternatively, configure an associated observing port for the mirrored port.
Precautions
An index corresponds to only one observing port.
After being configured as the observing port, the interface cannot be configured to process other services.
The same interface can serve as either the observing port or the mirrored port.
The observing port and mirrored port cannot be configured on the main interface or sub-interfaces of the same Eth-Trunk interface.
